thread.title: 'Hot Mugshot Guy' makes his New York Fashion Week debut

title: 'Hot Mugshot Guy' makes his New York Fashion Week debut

Photo: Neilson Barnard/Getty Images For New York Fashion Week: The Shows Image 44 of 44 'Hot Mugshot Guy' makes his New York Fashion Week debut 1 / 44 Back to Gallery Chiseled features, dreamy blue eyes, time in prison....check.
Jeremy Meeks, the " Hot Mugshot Guy ," took to the runway for the first time in the Philipp Plein show where he modeled a black trench trench with a furry hood, black pants, and black sneakers.
Meeks also had a shirtless moment, showing off muscles and several tattoos, but during the actual show, the model was covered up.
You might remember first seeing the viral mugshot of Jeremy Meeks mugshot in June of 2014. The then 30-year-old was arrested on felony weapon charges.
Runway Politics: Bella Hadid and powerful political statements come down the NYFW runway
Meeks quickly became dubbed the "Hot Felon" and "Hot Mugshot Guy."
Modeling agencies must have rejoiced when Meeks was released from prison in March of 2016.
(Story continues below.)
Jeremy Meeks, who became famous after his "hot mugshot" was released, has shared his first modeling photo on Instagram.
Media: Wibbitz In an Instagram post, Meeks captioned a photo with his talent agent Jim Jordan saying,"I want to thank my family and everybody for all your love, support and prayers. I'm overwhelmed and grateful for what lies ahead. I'm ready @jimjordanphotography and @whitecrossmanagement
#jeremymeeks #jimjordan #whitecrossmanagement."
Take a look at the "Hot Mugshot Guy's" runway debut and other looks from NYFW.
